    <p>Except when IFRS permits or requires otherwise, has the entity presented comparative information in respect of <b><u>at least</u></b> the preceding period for all amounts presented in the current period’s financial statements (primary statements and notes)?</p>
<p>NB1: The entity must include comparative information for narrative and descriptive information when it is relevant to gain an understanding of the current period’s financial statements.</p>
<p>NB2: Where specific disclosures do not need comparatives, this will be made clear on this disclosure checklist. </p>
<p>NB3: There is no restriction on disclosing comparative amounts that relate to periods earlier than the prior year (and sometimes this is specifically required), however, subject to IFRS 1, this information must be prepared in accordance with IFRS and where additional primary statements are disclosed, then the related note information must also be disclosed.</p>
